channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: China likely needs more than rate cuts to boost economic growth
item.description: More fiscal support is needed, analysts said, after the PBOC surprised markets by announcing plans to cut a number of rates.

item.title: Caught cold by UniCredit’s swoop on Commerzbank, Germany will want to avoid a national embarrassment
item.description: Italy's UniCredit appears to have caught German authorities off guard with a potential multibillion euro merger of Frankfurt-based Commerzbank.

item.title: Chinese yuan hits strongest level against dollar in over 16 months as investors assess PBOC stimulus
item.description: China's yuan briefly rose to its strongest level in over a year after Beijing unveiled a slate of stimulus measures to shore up the slowing economy.

item.title: Japan's largest rice shortage in years is exacerbated by sushi-hungry tourists, weather
item.description: Japanese rice is a key staple in many of its iconic dishes, but the country is facing its biggest shortfall in years.

item.title: 'Stop ripping us off': Senate grills Novo Nordisk CEO on weight loss drug pricing
item.description: Sen. Bernie Sanders argues that Novo Nordisk charges Americans substantially higher prices for its drugs than it does for patients in other countries.

item.title: OPEC is highly bullish on long-term oil demand growth. Not everyone agrees
item.description: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries, OPEC, published its World Oil Outlook for 2024, with optimistic forecasts for robust oil demand growth.

item.title: The unspoken rules of celebrating Oktoberfest in Munich
item.description: How to order a beer? Which side to tie a dirndl? Here's what to know about celebrating Octoberfest in Munich, the birthplace of the world-famous annual event.

item.title: These are the top 10 global talent hubs in the world — and the U.S. isn't one of them
item.description: Switzerland dominates as the world's most talent-competitive country, according to the 2024 IMD World Talent Ranking.

item.title: U.S. Steel CEO defends planned sale to Japan's Nippon, believes deal will close on its merits
item.description: U.S. Steel CEO David Burritt said the sale to Nippon would strengthen national, economic and job security.

item.title: FTX fraudster Caroline Ellison sentenced to 2 years in prison, ordered to forfeit $11 billion
item.description: Caroline Ellison, who headed a hedge fund affiliated with doomed crypto exchange FTX, testified against her former boyfriend Sam Bankman-Fried at trial.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: It might be better economic data isn’t all rosy
item.description: The fact that stocks continue rising even amid uneven economic data suggests the upward trajectory in markets is level-headed, for now.

item.title: Cathay Pacific bans couple after video showed inflight dispute over reclined seat
item.description: A video of the incident shows a couple taunting, using vulgar gestures and jostling the chair of a female passenger who reclined her seat on a long-haul flight.

item.title: OpenAI just launched advanced voice mode for audio chats with ChatGPT. Here's how to use it
item.description: If you're a paying customer, ChatGPT will respond to your spoken questions and comments quickly. But there's a limit to how much you can use it in a single day.

item.title: Justice Department accuses Visa of debit network monopoly that affects price of 'nearly everything’
item.description: Visa and Mastercard have surged over the past two decades, reaching a combined $1 trillion market cap. That has attracted unwanted attention from regulators.

item.title: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer says tough times are needed to spark national renewal
item.description: Starmer's efforts to instill a sense of optimism come after the government has been accused of doom-mongering over the state of the U.K. economy.

item.title: Meet the Latin American e-commerce platform that's outperforming Amazon this year
item.description: MercadoLibre has emerged as a top pick on Wall Street as investors search for tech opportunities beyond the Magnificent Seven.

item.title: Elliott to call for Southwest special meeting 'as soon as next week'
item.description: Elliott Management said Tuesday it will call a special meeting at Southwest Airlines as soon as next week.

item.title: 'We have much more on the way, if they will continue,' Israel's president says as death toll from IDF strikes on Lebanon passes 550
item.description: Israel's Monday airstrike into Lebanon, which killed more than 550 people, comes amid a dramatic escalation of hostilities on the border.

item.title: Biden's final UN speech seeks hope amid grim wars in the Middle East, Ukraine, Sudan
item.description: The Biden administration is working toward a cease-fire and hostage deal in Gaza, even as the president's term comes to a close.

item.title: Fed Governor Bowman explains dissent on rate vote, says she's worried about inflation
item.description: No governor had dissented from an interest rate decision since 2005.

item.title: Fed's jumbo interest rate cut puts the U.S. on track for a soft landing, Goldman CFO says
item.description: The Fed's move to lower interest rates by 50 basis points puts the U.S. economy on track for a soft landing, according to Goldman's chief financial officer.

item.title: Blackstone and Vista Equity Partners to acquire software maker Smartsheet for $8.4 billion
item.description: The $8.4 billion deal is expected to close in January 2025, and the collaboration software maker has the option to solicit other bids.

item.title: Commerzbank board member warns of significant job losses with a hostile UniCredit takeover
item.description: Commerzbank supervisory board member Stefan Wittmann told CNBC's Annette Weisbach that "we certainly hope we can avoid" a hostile takeover by the Italian bank.

item.title: Warner Bros. Discovery partners with Google for AI-generated captions on Max streaming service
item.description: Warner Bros. Discovery and Google are partnering to use AI to make captions more accurate on Max.

item.title: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon warns 'geopolitics is getting worse'
item.description: The JPMorgan Chase CEO said in an interview with CNBC-TV18 that his "caution is all geopolitics, which may determine the state of the economy."

item.title: Microsoft's GitHub gives clients option to keep sensitive code in EU only, in data sovereignty push
item.description: GitHub is giving enterprise users the ability to store their sensitive code on only EU servers, hoping to meet the bloc's strict approach to data regulation.

item.title: China bonds rally with yields hitting record lows after PBOC signals more easing to boost growth
item.description: China bond yields fell to a record low after the People's Bank of China announced that it will cut the reserve requirement ratio on Tuesday.

item.title: China launches probe into Calvin Klein parent over Xinjiang supply chain ‘disruptions’
item.description: China's Ministry of Commerce said it was launching a probe into Calvin Klein-parent PVH Group over alleged business disruptions involving Xinjiang.

item.title: China central bank releases slate of support measures amid a deepening economic slump
item.description: Beijing will cut the amount of cash banks need to have on hand, known as the reserve requirement ratio, or RRR, by 50 basis points in the near term, People's Bank of China Gov. Pan Gongsheng said.

item.title: China's auto stocks rise unfazed by U.S. proposal to ban Chinese car parts
item.description: Shares of Chinese automakers climbed in spite of news that the U.S. government is mulling a new proposal to ban Chinese and Russian car parts.
